results.title: Efficacy and safety of atenolol, enalapril, and isradipine in elderly hypertensive women.
results.text_hl: Antihypertensive efficacy was similar for the monotherapy drug regimens, with 84%, 71%, and 80% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Isradipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017275 @@@isradipine@@@, respectively, achieving @<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ goal.

citations.NLM: Perry HM Jr, Hall WD, Benz JR, Bartels DW, Kostis JB, Townsend RR, Due DL, Peng A, Sirgo M. Efficacy and safety of atenolol, enalapril, and isradipine in elderly hypertensive women. Am J Med. 1994 Jan;96(1):77-86. PMID: 8304366
citations.BibTeX: @article{8304366, title={Efficacy and safety of atenolol, enalapril, and isradipine in elderly hypertensive women.}, author={Perry HM Jr and Hall WD and Benz JR and Bartels DW and Kostis JB and Townsend RR and Due DL and Peng A and Sirgo M}, journal={Am J Med}, volume={96}, number={1}, pages={77-86}}

results.title: Prazosin GITS vs atenolol in patients with hypertension and normal lipid profile: a randomized, controlled multicenter study. Hyderabad Hypertension Study Group.
results.text_hl: Percent @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ < 90 mm Hg at 24 weeks: prazosin GITS--92.3%, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@--92.3%; SBP < 140 mm Hg: prazosin GITS--89.7% @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@--94.9% both @<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ < 90 mm Hg and SBP < 140 mm Hg: prazosin GITS--87.2%, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@--89.7%; percent @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ fall of 10 mm Hg or more at 24 weeks: prazosin GITS--92.3%, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@--100%.

citations.NLM: Joglekar SJ, Jaguste V, Nanivadekar AS. Prazosin GITS vs atenolol in patients with hypertension and normal lipid profile: a randomized, controlled multicenter study. Hyderabad Hypertension Study Group. J Assoc Physicians India. 1998;Suppl 1():41-51. PMID: 11233386
citations.BibTeX: @article{11233386, title={Prazosin GITS vs atenolol in patients with hypertension and normal lipid profile: a randomized, controlled multicenter study. Hyderabad Hypertension Study Group.}, author={Joglekar SJ and Jaguste V and Nanivadekar AS}, journal={J Assoc Physicians India}, volume={Suppl 1}, pages={41-51}}

results.title: Influence of losartan and atenolol on memory function in very elderly hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: At the end of the placebo period and of each active treatment period, BP was measured (by @CHEMICAL_Mercury @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008628 @@@mercury@@@ sphygmomanometer, Korotkoff I and V) and cognitive function was evaluated through three different tests (word list memory, word list recall and word list fluency). Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ were equally effective in reducing SBP (-22.1 and -23.1 mmHg, respectively, P< 0.01 vs baseline) and @<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ (-10.3 and -11.2 mmHg, respectively, P< 0.01 vs baseline).

citations.NLM: Fogari R, Mugellini A, Zoppi A, Derosa G, Pasotti C, Fogari E, Preti P. Influence of losartan and atenolol on memory function in very elderly hypertensive patients. J Hum Hypertens. 2003 Nov;17(11):781-5. PMID: 14578918
citations.BibTeX: @article{14578918, title={Influence of losartan and atenolol on memory function in very elderly hypertensive patients.}, author={Fogari R and Mugellini A and Zoppi A and Derosa G and Pasotti C and Fogari E and Preti P}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={17}, number={11}, pages={781-5}}

results.title: [Rilmenidine, a new antihypertensive agent in the first line treatment of essential arterial hypertension. Multicenter double-blind study versus atenolol].
results.text_hl: Both groups were similar at randomisation, and both treatments were similarly effective: after 8 weeks of monotherapy with @CHEMICAL_Rilmenidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077769 @@@rilmenidine@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, the SBP/@<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ had decreased by -18/-13 mmHg and by -21/-15 mmHg respectively, and the proportion of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with normalised blood pressure (SBP/@<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ less than or equal to 160/90 mmHg) was 66 percent and 65 percent.

citations.NLM: Dallocchio M, Gosse P, Fillastre JP, Grollier G, Morand P, Drici M, Corcoran C. [Rilmenidine, a new antihypertensive agent in the first line treatment of essential arterial hypertension. Multicenter double-blind study versus atenolol]. Presse Med. 1991 Aug 31-Sep 7;20(27):1265-71. PMID: 1832761
citations.BibTeX: @article{1832761, title={[Rilmenidine, a new antihypertensive agent in the first line treatment of essential arterial hypertension. Multicenter double-blind study versus atenolol].}, author={Dallocchio M and Gosse P and Fillastre JP and Grollier G and Morand P and Drici M and Corcoran C}, journal={Presse Med}, volume={20}, number={27}, pages={1265-71}}

results.title: Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women.
results.text_hl: After 4 weeks of treatment the nonresponder @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_261515</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:261515 @@@DBP@@@ >90 mm Hg) were given a double dose of each drug.

citations.NLM: Fogari R, Preti P, Zoppi A, Corradi L, Pasotti C, Rinaldi A, Mugellini A. Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women. Am J Hypertens. 2004 Jan;17(1):77-81. PMID: 14700518
citations.BibTeX: @article{14700518, title={Effect of valsartan and atenolol on sexual behavior in hypertensive postmenopausal women.}, author={Fogari R and Preti P and Zoppi A and Corradi L and Pasotti C and Rinaldi A and Mugellini A}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={77-81}}
